Welcome to ManageXPence "

" ADD AN EXPENSE "
" You can add an expense that you made along with a description in a date. These three elements are written in a file on your device. You can also add your own description by pressing the ADD button.if you need a description that is not in the dropdown list. "

"
ADD INCOME "
" You can add your income and the app will show your balance (income minus the expenses made for the current month). Every time you add an expensethe balance is updated. Also you can set a payment circle for the app to show you the balance according to that circle and not the calendar month. This is applied only in the balance and not in the charts which show expenses by month."
"

Welcome to ManageXPence "

" EDIT AN EXPENSE "
" The edit button gives you the option to edit or delete an expense from the file. In order to do that you may search for an expense by description or by amount, select the one you need and then edit or delete it. "

"
SUM EXPENSES "
" You can add expenses that occured between two dates. Simply add the dates in the form dd/mm/yyyy and among them add the hyphen - symbol. The app will sum for you the expenses made between these two dates. Also you can select a description and the app will sum the expenses you made only for that description in the period you entered. "

"
REPORT EXPENSES "
" A report shows all the expenses on your file. Initially it displays the current month expenses. There is also a dropdown menu where you can see all of the other months expenses as well the total expenses added.

Welcome to ManageXPence "

" BUDGET CONTROL "
" You can set a budget warning amount and let ManageXPence notify you when you have reached the 80, the 90 and the 100 percent of that amount. Simply drag the seek bar to set the warning and this amount will be stored in the app, it will not be changed unless you do so. You can always turn off these notifications from settings."

"
BACKUP "
" You can export the file with the expenses in DROPBOX after you link the app with your account in DROPBOX (if you have one) Also you can export it as a text file named as expenses.txt, or as a PDF named as expenses.pdf in your Download folder of your Device Storage. On the other hand you can import the file from your Download folder of the device storage to ManageXPence.

Welcome to ManageXPence "

" That means you can edit the file when it is on your device storage if you want to make many changes and then import it. Just make sure you keep the initial structure of the file, to avoid malfunctions, namely maximum 7 characters in the amount, maximum 15 characters in the description and the date should be equal to 10 characters. The import will be made from the text file expenses.txt and is available if you purchase the PRO version."

"
VISUAL EXPENSES "
" A pie chart will show all your expenses that are added on your file. They are classified by month and you can switch from percentages to numbers. A bar chart displays all the expenses as well. They are classified by month as well and you can switch from percentages to numbers.

Welcome to ManageXPence "\n\n" An annual chart shows all the expenses made for every month, so that you can compare your expenses between months. Also, you can see how much you have spent for every expense in a year by clicking the link at the bottom of the Annual Chart screen. A savings chart displays the savings made for every month. Every month is calculated with the income you had entered on that month. If you have not entered an income in a month then the current month income is considered.
